title: (x) Veronica Mars credits - Helvetica Extended {Patricia}
content:
Hey all, I'm trying to ID the font/s used in this graphic:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140307215847im_/http:/typophile.com/files/1vmjt8_4841.jpg)

The closest I've come is:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140307215847im_/http:/typophile.com/files/veronica_3631.png)

But it's not quite the same. Can you help?
author: BepperGirl

comments.content: I think you got it - weights of Helvetica - but the distressing in the sample rounded the edges.

Ah, thank you! I was going insane. I was like, it's quite similar, but the A and R in Veronica taper off differently. It's like more rounded than the Helvetica I used. ("veronica" is Helvetica Neue 53 extended and "MARS" is Helvetica Neue 83 Heavy Extended, right?
